item.title: Two yellow works fencing panels left lying on pavement, 11th December
item.description:
These two pieces of fencing are often left lying on the pavement causing people to have to deftly pick a path around them and causing considerable trip hazard. They have been here now for around two months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheringham Road, Anerley, Greater London

item.title: Estate agent sign abandoned, 11th December
item.description:
This sign has been seen up and down Foxgrove Road for almost a year. It’s now on the grass verge. I’ve contacted the company several times this year to inform them and ask them to remove it. They haven’t.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxgrove Road, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: New flytipping hotspot, 11th December
item.description:
This is just the latest incidence of flytipping outside the bins door of the block of flats on Sylvan Hill. At first it seemed that it might just be a resident who was doing some DIY, but after three or four different loads have now been dumped there it's starting to look like some cowboys have found a new favourite dumping ground. This spot is overlooked from so many angles - there must be a way of keeping tabs on it to catch whoever is doing it before they start to assume they can dump whatever they like there without fear of punishment.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sylvan Hill, Upper Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hoover left on the street - this has to stop, 11th December
item.description:
I’m sick of people acting like absolute pigs and dumping their rubbish all over the street. Why do we pay COUNCIL TAX??? Maybe hackney council should explain how we recycle electronic devises?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Londesborough Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grate poking out the ground, 11th December
item.description:
There's a grate/drain that is poking upward slightly - i caught my foot on it and fell over, and it stabbed into my shoe. Fortunately I was wearing boots and they now have a hole but not the entire way through. I thought this might be dangerous so should report
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Harrow Place, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Straight after speedbump outside of m&S, 11th December
item.description:
The hole is now around 20cm deep - i drove over it in my mini this morning when still dark and not visible - the bottom of the car hit the road with a bang it is so deep, then i see this was reported in november and inspected yet not planned to be repaired?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
